Fourteen week, live-in, all inclusive bootcamp in the Bay Area. We lived in the house where we learned and worked. No time wasted commuting, thinking about our next meal, or washing the dishes. I coded for, sometimes, fourteen hours a day (average of twelve), six days a week. The first seven weeks was spent on the MEAN Stack, the second seven weeks was MERN Stack with a final project in React Native and a focus on CS.

I am very proud to have greaduated from the College of Anthropology at the UofO. My peers were passionate and our professors were highly experienced and inspiring. On top of Anthropology, I took a diverse courseload. From physics to religious studies to history to military science to the Arabic language. My time with the cadets, officers, and support staff of the UofO ROTC was especially valuable to me. I had a lot of fun learning the hard and soft lessons I learned from them.

recommendations: Elliot is a pleasure to work with. Excellent communication both verbal and written. He has a very calm and soothing way about him that gets people to relax quickly. Intelligent, he picks up anything he puts his mind to very quickly. A natural leader, he gets the team pumped up and shows them what to do next. He is a great coder and although he is not expert yet, give him a few days with a new technology and he will develop a strong proficiency.  It would be a great honor to work with him again.
